action.action-desc: Ms. Duckworth (for herself, Ms. Speier, Mr. Schiff, Mr. Cohen, Mr. Quigley, Mr. Johnson of Georgia, Mr. Van Hollen, Mr. Engel, Mr. Grayson, Ms. Esty, Mr. Lowenthal, Mr. David Scott of Georgia, and Ms. Lofgren) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To clarify the definition of nonimmigrant for purposes of chapter 44 of title 18, United States Code.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Visa Waiver Program Firearms Clarification Act of 2015.
Section 922 of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (d)(5)(B), by inserting or pursuant to the Visa Waiver Program established under section 217 of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1187) before the semicolon at the end;
in subsection (g)(5)(B), by inserting or pursuant to the Visa Waiver Program established under section 217 of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1187) before the semicolon at the end; and

subparagraph.text: in the subsection heading, by inserting or pursuant to the Visa Waiver Program after visas;

in paragraph (2), in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by inserting or pursuant to the Visa Waiver Program established under section 217 of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1187) after visa; and

in paragraph (3)(A), in the matter preceding clause (i), by inserting or pursuant to the Visa Waiver Program established under section 217 of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1187) after visa.
